text: Arjun Firoz Khan (born 9 January 1962) is an Indian actor. He is best known for playing the supporting character of Arjuna in B.R. Chopra's epic television series Mahabharat (1988 TV series). After it was a success, Firoz Khan changed his name professionally to Arjun. He has also acted in many movies with the Hindi language. He was nominated for the Arjuna Award for playing the role of Arjuna in Mahabharata (1988 Television series). == Personal life == Firoz Khan was born on 9 January 1962 into a Muslim family. He was a student of Smt. MMK College of Commerce and Economics, in Mumbai. Later he went to Oxford University, where he finished his studies. He is married to Kashmira. The couple have three children â€“ a son and two daughters. His son, Jibran Khan is also an actor. He who played the role of Dhruva in Vishnu Puran and Krishna in Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham... ==Awards== He was nominated for the Best Supporting Role along with Sunil Lahri who was nominated for the role of Laxman ===Mahabharata (1988 television)=== Best Supporting Role-Arjuna == References == == Other websites == * Category:Indian movie actors Category:Indian television actors Category:Living people Category:1962 births Category:Actors from Mumbai
title: Arjun Firoz Khan
